flawed_nl_solution:
Book 1 was $12.50 and book 2 was $15.00 so 13.0 +15.0 = $28.0
He was buying 4 books, so these 2 were 25% off so 28.0 * 0.25 = $7.0
These two books came out to 28.0-7.0 = $<<28.0-7.0=26.0>>26.0
Books 3 & 4 were both $10.0 each so 2*10.0 = $20.0
When you add all 4 books together, 26.0+20.0 = $<<26.0+20.0=46.0>>46.0
To get free shipping he would need to spend 50.0-46.0 = $<<50.0-46.0=4.0>>4.0 more on books

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 21.0, not 26.0. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
